channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: The alleyways and footpaths between the streets are hugely overgrown, 2nd July
item.description:
Hugely overgrown footpaths and alleyways behind Radnor Road to Alma Road. Almost impossible to pass with a pram at some points.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 14, Thirlmere Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Damage to retaining wall and no slope, 2nd July
item.description:
The wall that retains the path at the end of denbigh today is damaged. The steps also are a problem for pushchairs and wheelchairs, should be changed for a step free slope.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Denbigh Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Uneven pavement, people keep falling over, 2nd July
item.description:
The pavement directly outside of the Coventry Building Society is uneven and members of the public are falling over on a regular basis.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 20, Promenade, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocking visibility on road/junction (Grass/verge) problem, 2nd July
item.description:
Verges haven't been cut for years and has had 2 near misses. However so much rubbish left behind from Contractors, due to the cycle lane
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The sign is illegible problem, 2nd July
item.description:
A resident phoned concerned that this circus sign had caused an obstruction when she was driving. She was surprised by a pedestrian she could not see crossing from the pavement onto the pedestrian crossing. The sign has now been removed. - see thread attached
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Depression in carriageway., 2nd July
item.description:
Pothole in lane 1 south-bound Jct 11 M5. I see that the same issue was reported in March, and noted as ‘resolved’, but the problem is still there, or deteriorated from previous attention.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): M5, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: TMC - Defects - Vegetation problem, 2nd July
item.description:
28 day with 2 way traffic lights please cut back overgrown hedge an vegetation growing out over footway 45000x3000 (Overgrown Hedge)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Badly broken pavement, 2nd July
item.description:
Visiting Cheltenham from Scotland, as I was walking past 290 Gloucester Road (approx) on Friday 28th June towards the train station on station side of the road I tripped on badly broken up pavement, needed to go to A&E, have broken right elbow and badly bruised left hand. This is an extremely hazardous pavement to walk along.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 292, Gloucester Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: TMC - Defects - Other problem, 2nd July
item.description:
